fixes.name: Delta -50 T
fixes.dax_expression:
VAR UseCustomDate = SELECTEDVALUE('Use Custom Date'[Display As])
VAR EndDateParam = SELECTEDVALUE('End Date'[Display As])
VAR EffDate = 'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[EFFECTIVE_DATE]
VAR MaxDateExclude = 'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[Max Date Exclude]
VAR Delta50 = 'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'[DELTA_50]
RETURN
IF(
    UseCustomDate,
    IF(MaxDateExclude = EffDate, Delta50, 0),
    IF(EffDate = EndDateParam, Delta50, 0)
)
fixes.solution_explanation: Converted the nested Tableau IFs to DAX using VARs for clarity. Parameter references were replaced with SELECTEDVALUE('ParameterName'[Display As]) per rules. All column references were converted to the 'TableName'[ColumnName] format for the table 'Risk_GFIRates_Reports_Excel_Rolling (local copy)'. The logic preserves the original nested conditional behavior.
fixes.type_changed_reason: The calculation references parameters ([Parameters].[Use Custom Date] and [Parameters].[End Date]); per the rules, any parameter-based calculation must be created as a measure.
